meta.description: Learn how OpenEconomy works: set your value, list skills, find matches, and exchange fairly. Four simple steps to trading skills without money.

hero.headline: Four steps to fair exchange
hero.subheadline: OpenEconomy makes it easy to trade skills fairly. No money changes hands‚Äîjust fair value for fair value.

items.title: Set Your Value
items.subtitle: You decide what your time is worth
items.description: Your 'hourly baseline' is the foundation of fair exchange. It's how we calculate equivalent value between different skills.

options.title: Based on your salary
options.description: Take your annual salary, divide by 2,000. That's your starting point.

options.title: Based on your rates
options.description: What do you charge for your services? Use that as your baseline.

options.title: Based on your skills
options.description: Consider what someone with your experience would earn.

items.title: List Your Skills
items.subtitle: Share what you can offer‚Äîand what you need
items.description: Every skill has value. From coding to cooking, gardening to guitar lessons.

items.title: Find Matches
items.subtitle: Connect with people who need what you offer
items.description: Browse the community yourself, or let our matching algorithm suggest connections.

items.title: Exchange Fairly
items.subtitle: Propose, agree, complete, confirm
items.description: Found a match? Here's how an exchange works from start to finish.

phases.title: Propose
phases.description: Send a proposal with what you need and what you'll provide.

phases.title: Negotiate
phases.description: Agree on terms until both parties are satisfied.

phases.title: Complete
phases.description: Do the work and mark it completed.

phases.title: Confirm & Rate
phases.description: Both parties confirm and rate the exchange.

header.headline: Reputation you earn, trust you keep
header.subheadline: Your reputation is built through completed exchanges, not purchased or gamed.

items.question: What if an exchange is unbalanced?
items.answer: The system warns you if values differ by more than 10%. Small imbalances are recorded as credit/debit and even out over time.

items.question: What if someone doesn't complete their part?
items.answer: First, try to work it out directly. If that fails, raise a dispute. A neutral mediator will help resolve it.

items.question: Can I change my hourly rate?
items.answer: Yes, anytime. Changes apply to new exchanges only. Existing agreements keep their original terms.

items.question: Is this like bartering?
items.answer: Similar concept, but smarter. OpenEconomy uses time-value normalization, so you can exchange with anyone and balance over time.

items.question: Do I need cryptocurrency?
items.answer: No! The blockchain records exchanges for transparency, but you never need to buy or hold crypto.
